rogel.io.fopl.proof

Class RuleSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • rogel.io.fopl.proof.RuleSet

  • public class RuleSet
extends java.lang.Object
    The RuleSet is the logic base, a list of HornClauses that are used for the construction of the proof tree during resolution.
    Author:
    recardona

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RuleSet(HornClause... rules)
      Constructs a RuleSet from a list of HornClauses.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      HornClause getRule(int index)
      Returns the HornClause rule at the given index within the RuleSet.
      int getRuleCount()
      Returns the number of HornClause rules within this RuleSet.
      HornClause getRuleStandardizedApart(int index)
      Returns the HornClause rule at the given index within the RuleSet with its Variables standardized apart.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • RuleSet

        public RuleSet(HornClause... rules)
        Constructs a RuleSet from a list of HornClauses.
        Parameters:
        rules - A varargs of HornClause objects that collectively define the logic base for resolution, not null.

    • Method Detail

      • getRule

        public HornClause getRule(int index)
        Returns the HornClause rule at the given index within the RuleSet.

        Returns:
        a HornClause at the given index.

      • getRuleStandardizedApart

        public HornClause getRuleStandardizedApart(int index)
        Returns the HornClause rule at the given index within the RuleSet with its Variables standardized apart.
        Parameters:
        index - The non-negative index of the rule within the RuleSet to get.
        Returns:
        a HornClause with Variables that have been standardized apart.

        public int getRuleCount()
        Returns the number of HornClause rules within this RuleSet.
